title: California wildfire: Kim Kardashian demands pay raise for firefighters, $1 per hour since 1984 - Mint
summary:
California wildfire: Kim Kardashian demands pay raise for firefighters, $1 per hour since 1984

Publication Date: Not specifiedSource: Live Mint

Kim Kardashian expressed gratitude to firefighters in California, emphasizing the plight of incarcerated individuals who fight wildfires for just $1 per hour.

Key Points:

  • The death toll from the wildfires has reached 16, with over 12,000 structures destroyed.
  • Kardashian highlighted the dangerous conditions faced by incarcerated firefighters.
  • She revealed that their pay has not changed since 1984, despite inflation and worsening fire conditions.
  • Previously proposed pay increase to $5/hour was denied.
  • Kardashian called on California Governor Gavin Newsom to raise the pay for incarcerated firefighters.
“I am urging to do what no Governor has done in 4 decades, and raise the incarcerated firefighter pay to a rate that honors a human being risking their life to save our lives and homes.”

In conclusion, Kim Kardashian's message calls for reform in the treatment and compensation of incarcerated firefighters who bravely face the dangers of wildfires.
newTitle: Kim Kardashian Advocates for Increased Pay for Incarcerated Firefighters in California Wildfires

title: Game Changer Box Office Collections: Ram Charan film sees a steep drop on day 2 in India - PINKVILLA
summary:
Game Changer Box Office Collections: Ram Charan Film Sees a Steep Drop on Day 2 in India

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Pinkvilla

Game Changer witnessed a significant drop at the Indian box office on its second day with collections plummeting to Rs. 24.50 crore, reflecting a 60% decline overall.

  • The two-day cumulative box office gross stands at approximately Rs. 83.50 crore in India.
  • Telugu states experienced an over 70% drop, accumulating only Rs. 12 crore on the second day.
  • Tamil Nadu's performance was disappointing, grossing a mere Rs. 4 crore over the two days.
  • The film's fate was sealed even before release due to its high budget and insufficient pre-release recoveries.
  • Holiday opportunities in Telugu states may help, but expectations are low.
“The drop on the second day has sealed the fate of the film.”

In conclusion, despite the holiday period, the financial prospects for Game Changer appear bleak as it grapples with poor box office performance.
newTitle: Game Changer Box Office Collections: Ram Charan Film Sees a Steep Drop on Day 2 in India

Tabu, known for her role in Dune: Prophecy, announces her participation in the horror comedy Bhooth Bangla, reuniting with Akshay Kumar and director Priyadarshan.

title: Madha Gaja Raja movie review: Vishal, Santhanam power this Sundar C throwback to simpler yet sus times - The Indian Express
summary:
Madha Gaja Raja movie review

Date: January 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The review discusses the unique circumstances of viewing 'Madha Gaja Raja', a film that was delayed for 12 years and addresses how it holds up a decade later. It captures the humorous essence and critiques of the film's approach to comedy and narrative.

  • The film is directed by Sundar C and features a mix of nostalgia and humor.
  • Vishal and Santhanam deliver strong performances, especially in comedic roles.
  • The narrative follows Raja's antics with friends and includes action sequences that slow the pacing.
  • The review highlights the irreverent humor characteristic of Sundar C’s films.
  • Despite its flaws, the film successfully entertains with comedic elements and nostalgic references.
The movie’s strength is comedy, and any time it moves away from that, it falters.

Overall, while the film reflects a mix of dated elements and timeless humor, it shows Sundar C’s enduring capability to engage audiences through laughter.
newTitle: Madha Gaja Raja Movie Review: A Nostalgic Comedy Experience

title: Game Changer Box Office Day 2 (All Languages): Ram Charan Beats His Acharya With 65% Higher 2-Day Total! - Koimoi
summary:
Game Changer Box Office Day 2 (All Languages): Ram Charan Beats His Acharya With 65% Higher 2-Day Total!

Publication Date: January 11, 2024 | Source: Koimoi

Ram Charan and Kiara Advani’s political action thriller Game Changer is enjoying a decent run at the box office, scoring the biggest Sankranti opening of all time, though it has seen a dip in collections on Day 2.

Key Points:

  • Game Changer earned 22 crores on Day 2, suffering a 59% drop from Day 1's 54 crores.
  • The film had a total collection of 76 crores over the first two days.
  • Game Changer is 65% ahead of Ram Charan's previous film Acharya in terms of the two-day total.
  • The film, directed by S Shankar, was released on January 10, 2024, coinciding with the Sankranti holiday.
“Game Changer must make the most of the weekend holiday to achieve the box office milestone!”

Given its substantial budget of 400-500 crores, the film has potential for high returns if box office trends improve.
newTitle: Game Changer Box Office Day 2: Ram Charan Outperforms Acharya

title: 'Game Changer' box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan and Kiara Advani starrer mints a whopping Rs 72.5 - TOI Etimes
summary:
Game Changer box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan and Kiara Advani starrer mints a whopping Rs 72.5 crore

Publication Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Times of India

'Game Changer', directed by Shankar, hit the screens on January 10, 2025, and has garnered significant earnings. The film received positive reviews, especially for Ram Charan's performance.

  • The film grossed Rs 51 crore on its opening day.
  • On the second day, it earned Rs 21.5 crore, bringing the total to Rs 72.5 crore.
  • Second day earnings breakdown: Rs 12.7 crore (Telugu), Rs 7 crore (Hindi), Rs 1.7 crore (Tamil), Rs 10 lakhs (Kannada).
  • The overall occupancy rates were strong, with 31.19% in Telugu theatres.
  • The film features Ram Charan as an IAS officer fighting against corruption.
“The film is likely to dominate the box office during the upcoming festive season.”

The success of 'Game Changer' suggests a promising run at the box office, with expectations of sustained earnings in the weeks to come.
newTitle: Game Changer box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan and Kiara Advani starrer mints a whopping Rs 72.5 crore

Game Changer worldwide box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan and Kiara Advani’s film sees massive dip, collects Rs 72.5 crore - The Indian Express
summary:
Game Changer worldwide box office collection Day 2

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 - Source: Indian Express

Ram Charan and Kiara Advani’s highly anticipated film, Game Changer, has faced a significant decline in its box office collections following its release.

  • The film earned Rs 51 crore on its opening day across all languages.
  • On Day 2, the collection dropped to Rs 21.5 crore, marking a decline of 57.84%.
  • The total box office collection stands at Rs 72.5 crore in India.
  • The Telugu version has accumulated Rs 53.95 crore; the Hindi version Rs 14.5 crore; the Tamil version Rs 3.82 crore; and the Malayalam and Kannada versions Rs 0.03 crore and Rs 0.02 crore respectively.
  • Occupancy rates indicate a 31.19% occupancy for the Telugu version and 21.82% for the Hindi version.
The king’s arrival is setting the box office ablaze 🤙🏼 #GameChanger takes a blockbuster opening at the BOX OFFICE 💥💥

Despite its promising start, the film has been criticized for allegedly inflating its Day 1 earnings, which were initially reported as Rs 186 crore worldwide.
newTitle: Game Changer worldwide box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan’s film sees massive dip, collects Rs 72.5 crore

Recently, during a promotional event, actor VTV Ganesh revealed that Thalapathy 69 is a remake of Bhagavanth Kesari. However, Anil reportedly turned down the chance to direct Vijay.

  • Director Anil Ravipudi is preparing for the release of Sankranthiki Vasthunnam.
  • Actor VTV Ganesh disclosed Thalapathy 69 as a remake, but Anil declined to direct it.

Fateh box office collection day 2: Sonu Sood, Jacqueline Fernandez film sees minor dip on Saturday - Hindustan Times
summary:
Fateh Box Office Collection Day 2: Sonu Sood's Film Sees Minor Dip

Date: Jan 12, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The action entertainer Fateh, directed by Sonu Sood, experienced a dip in box office collections on its second day, earning ₹2 crore, which is ₹40 lakhs less than its opening day.

  • Fateh earned ₹2 crore on Saturday, down from ₹2.4 crore on Friday.
  • The film faces competition from the Hindi dubbed version of S Shankar's Game Changer.
  • Ticket prices were initially set at ₹99, which contributed to better opening numbers.
  • Sonu Sood aims to donate the entire profit from the film to charity.
  • The film tackles themes of courage and cybercrime, based on real-life experiences during the COVID-19 pandemic.
“Fateh is a film made for the common man, and I wanted it to reach everyone in the most accessible way across India,” Sonu Sood said.

Despite its promising start, Fateh's performance shows that it might struggle to maintain momentum amidst stiff competition.
newTitle: Fateh Box Office Collection Day 2: Sonu Sood's Film Sees Minor Dip

title: Kangana Ranaut holds first screening of Emergency for Nitin Gadkari: 'After 6 months of struggle, film is ready' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kangana Ranaut Holds Special Screening of 'Emergency' for Nitin Gadkari

Date: Jan 12, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Kangana Ranaut held a special screening of her upcoming film 'Emergency' in Nagpur, attended by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari and co-star Anupam Kher. The film is set for release on January 17.

  • Kangana discussed the film's strict censor board scrutiny and lengthy preparation process.
  • Nitin Gadkari praised the film for accurately portraying a significant historical period in India.
  • The film features notable actors including Anupam Kher and Shreyas Talpade.
“Today, we are actually having the first screening of the film... After six months of struggle, the film is finally ready.” - Kangana Ranaut

The film aims to shed light on the Emergency period imposed by Indira Gandhi from 1975 to 1977.

Actor Rashmika Mandanna has provided an update on her health following a leg injury sustained at the gym. She took to Instagram to share her situation and apologized to directors of her films for the resulting delays.

This weekly horoscope reveals the luck and predictions for each zodiac sign from January 12 to January 18, providing insights into personal and professional aspects of life.

  • Gemini: Strengthen community connections; mental health improves.
  • Cancer: Assertive leadership; family harmony; trust your judgment on investments.
  • Leo: Time to slow down and appreciate life; recoveries in health.
  • Virgo: Work feels tedious; focus on peace at home.
  • Libra: Be aware of indirect actions from others; love life gets busier.
  • Scorpio: Calm approach helps in managing stress and family matters.
  • Sagittarius: Nostalgia returns with a focus on lessons learned.
  • Capricorn: Transition brings new routines; adaptability is key.
  • Aquarius: Productivity spikes with multiple projects; watch for manipulative individuals.
  • Pisces: A quiet period for rest and reflection; consider spiritual practices.

title: Telangana govt withdraws orders allowing ticket price hike for Ram Charan starrer 'Game Changer' - Deccan Herald
summary:
Telangana Government Withdraws Ticket Price Hike for 'Game Changer'

Date: 12 January 2025

Source: Deccan Herald

The Telangana government has withdrawn its earlier orders that allowed for a hike in ticket prices for the Ram Charan starrer 'Game Changer', complying with directions from the High Court.

  • The government had initially approved higher ticket prices for special early morning shows.
  • The new orders will take effect from January 16.
  • High Court directed that early morning shows will not be permitted until public health and safety are assessed.
  • Criticism arose from opposition MLA regarding the original price hike approval.
“The state Cinematography Minister spoke against the price hike in the wake of a tragic incident at a previous film premiere.”

This decision reflects the government's response to public safety concerns and legal directives.
newTitle: Telangana Government Withdraws Ticket Price Hike for 'Game Changer'
